page.title: 09RISEBRIDGE FARM
page.content: At Risebridge Farm they have turned a hop farm into holiday cottages. They started by getting planning permission and then they went from there. Before the holiday cottages were made they were used for keeping cattle in. There are nine cottages altogether. Each cottage has the same furniture as most of us would have at our own houses. From the few animals they have like cows and goats they get milk and make butter, youghurt and cheese, and you can buy all of theese in their little shop. Including all the holiday cottages and the spare land they use for cattle, there are 115 acres. There are lots of things to do. Here are some: Tennis, Swimming and Squash. They also have a Sauna bath and Jacuzzi. They grow Gooseberries, raspberries, potatoes and more to sell to their guests.
